sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RAMNAGUR a town of Hindustan, in the province of Allahabad, and district of Benares, which stands on the eastern bank of the Ganges, opposite the city of Benares, and is esteemed one of the neatest towns of its size in India ; the houses are of stone, and the streets of a good breadth. It contains also the palace of the rajah, and a very handsome small temple, covered with figures in alto-relievo, having in front an extensive reservoir, and surrounded by gardens. It was the favourite residence of Cheyt Sing. Long. 83. 1. E. Lat. 25. 30. N.
